answers.answer: After reading your post it appears it has two separate subject matters, diabetes and foot/leg issues. Several questions come to  mind and are in need of clarification.Diabetes -1. Lab ranges and perception of what normal levels are are not well defined in your post. It would help if you posted the ranges exactly as they appear from your lab results.2. What does "Long term glucose around 6.4 which is borderline for diabetes." mean? The term "long term glucose" may apply to long term diabetes care, or long term glucose care, the key word is "care". If it was meant as an A1c test result then 6.4% is not borderline diabetes but unfortunately diabetes; 6.4%=137 mg/dl eAG, where diabetes begins at 126mg/dl.3. Have you been tested for neuropathy, damage to a nerve or nerves which can affect your lower extremities [leg/feet]?Foot/leg -1. Another forum to post foot/leg issues is Ask A Doctor - Foot Care (Podiatry).

question: Thank you for all that reply since it is my first time here.  I have had several test performed to try to diagnose or understand why my tingling continues.  It started when I was 7 months pregnant in 2005.  It started with a pressure around one toe on left foot and upon standing for longer than 5 minutes pins and needles on left side of upper thigh.  Neurolgy lower back MRI found nothing.  All disk look okay.  All blood test normal.  Glucose tolerence tests normal.  Fasting glucose normal.  Long term glucose around 6.4 which is borderline for diabetes.  All lab test were normal where they looked for every disease or abnormal lab values.  B12 normal.  Folate high.  I did have a baby with anenchephaly in 2001.  So during the beginning of pregnancy and 6 months prior I took 5g of folic acid..I am currently taking Lyrica very low dose due to tolerance 25mg twice a day, and just recently this week started gabapentin 100mg three times daily. Went to chropractor and they said they probably could not do much for me.  They did mention that my tendons under my feet were extremely tight in knots.  I also will have my toes bend by themselves sometimes and get stuck for short periods till I move them.  Sometimes my legs in the morning get severe painful cramps.  I took vitamins and B complex no help.  Anyone have any ideas?  As I said it started with a tight feeling like there was a rubber band around one toe.  Two years later in 2007 while dancing with my child I felt a strange wet release in the toe and never had that tight rubber band feeling around that toe again.  Now both feet have numbness under them and especially around the toes and bed surronding the toes.
title: Tingling under feet near and under toes
